name: incalculably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an extreme way that is unable to be measured: The odds of this happening were incalculably small. His family is incalculably rich. See
incalculable
More examplesFewer examplesThe future looks incalculably more threatening.His range of experience is incalculably more limited than that of any of the other candidates.The band’s music has gained incalculably in popularity over the past year.
